meanings.definition: The action of keeping something harmful under control or within limits.
meanings.sent1: The containment of the fire prevented it from spreading to other buildings.
meanings.sent2: The containment of the spill was successful, minimizing environmental damage.
meanings.sent3: The containment of the mischievous puppy in the backyard proved to be a challenge.
meanings.sent4: Her containment of emotions was like a dam holding back a flood of tears.
meanings.sent5: The containment of the virus required strict quarantine measures.

meanings.definition: The act of enclosing something within a boundary.
meanings.sent1: The containment of the garden with a fence kept out unwanted animals.
meanings.sent2: The containment of the toys in the box made cleanup easier.
meanings.sent3: The containment of the excited children in the play area was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: The containment of the secrets within the diary was crucial for privacy.
meanings.sent5: The containment of the water in the pool created a refreshing oasis.

meanings.definition: The policy of preventing the spread of communism during the Cold War.
meanings.sent1: The containment of communism was a key strategy in the Cold War.
meanings.sent2: The containment of the ideology required diplomatic and military efforts.
meanings.sent3: The containment of the rumor about aliens visiting Earth was a humorous challenge.
meanings.sent4: The containment of the political unrest mirrored the containment of a wildfire.
meanings.sent5: The containment of the ideology within certain borders shaped global politics.
